intro: Diapedium martinicense, commonly known as the Martinique starling vine, is a climbing plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are typically clustered in cymes. Its fruits are berries that turn from green to red as they mature. Diapedium martinicense is often found in moist, shaded environments in tropical forests.
